pr_title: Resolves #848: Allow for setting the FDB transaction timeout on FDBRecordContexts

timeline.bodyText: This is alluding to that behavior change regarding the transaction ID that is mentioned in the PR's overview comment.

timeline.bodyText: These are "breaking changes" for implementors of the interface, if we care about that use case. They are fine for those that are using the interface.

Maybe the release notes should call out this minor (unlikely) breaking change (I did something like this on 2.8.103.0:

replies.bodyText: Okay, added release notes calling it out. For these two methods, I attached the issue (#848) as they seemed "inherent" to that Issue. I also call out the slight change in semantics regarding transaction IDs, but with this PR, as it seemed more "incidental".
replies.author: alecgrieser

timeline.message: refactor FDBRecordContext configuration to a separate config object with a builder

Resolves #848: Allow for setting the FDB transaction timeout on FDBRecordContexts

This adds a configuration option to the FDBRecordContextConfig that allows the user to set a transaction timeout. It also allows the user to specify a default value for that timeout, either for the full database or on a specific runner.
